result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jamie Lynn Kreitzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed on count one.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Successfully complete anger management counseling and parenting classes.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed.
Filed by Atty Steven Sarbacker.
Filed by Atty Steven Sarbacker.

Defendant Jamie Lynn Kreitzman in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker. Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment on ct. 2, sentence withheld, 1 yr. probation, conds. successfully complete anger management counseling and parenting classes. $443 court costs. Court withheld finding of guilt on ct. 1.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement accepted. Count 1 held open 18 months for compliance with Agreement.  Court granted 3 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed by ADA Genda
